original:
Allometry refers to the study of the relationship between the size of an organism and its various biological characteristics. This relationship is often expressed through a scaling exponent based on body mass or body length (such as snout–vent length or total length). 

In a perfectly allometrically scaling organism, volume-based properties would change proportionally to body mass, surface area-based properties would scale with mass to
